passages.text:
Hello there. Can I help you with something?
[[Who are you?->Who]]
passages.name: Start

passages.text:
My, that's a bit forward of you. Well, if you couldn't tell by my clothes, I'm a nun bound in eternal service to the church. And to the priestess, I guess. She's the one who tells me what to do.
[[Do you like being a nun?->Like being nun]]
[[Do you believe everything the priestess says?->Believe priestess]]

links.name: Do you like being a nun?
Do you believe everything the priestess says?

passages.name: Who

passages.text:
Well, I don't really enjoy fishing, so I guess I like it better than the alternative. And I've grown quite fond of my duties in the church. Scrubbing floors may seem boring at first, but once you've done it a thousand times you realize there's actually quite an art to it.
[[That sounds nice.->Nice]]
[[That sounds sad.->Sad]]
passages.name: Like being nun

passages.text:
Why wouldn't I? The town is still here after all these years of unfavorable winters and short summers. We must be doing something right. Besides, the whole idea of the church is rather beautiful, don't you think?
[[Yes.->Yes]]
[[No.->No]]
passages.name: Believe priestess

passages.text:
Nice? Oh, sure. It certainly does keep me busy.
[[Continue]]
passages.name: Nice

passages.text:
Oh, does it? I guess it may seem that way to you. I prefer to view it as stable. Balanced.
[[Continue]]
passages.name: Sad

passages.text:
It's just so wonderful to think that everything we do matters, isn't it? Nothing that happens in this town is happening in a void. Every breath we take tips the scale one way or another.
[[Continue]]
passages.name: Yes

passages.text:
No? Well, the festival may change your mind. It truly is a beautiful spectacle.
[[Continue]]
passages.name: No

passages.text: Well, I must return to my duties. May the tides be in your favor!
passages.name: Continue
